intro: Pelecyphora chihuahuensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua pelecyphora, is a rare flowering plant native to the Chihuahua region of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapted to the dry climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed, a trait common among members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
